content: @Jasun Carr I had a good conversation with @Nick Cameron just now. One topic we talked about is how we can work better given we're highly distributed (with me in Europe, Nick in New Zealand, and you in the States). One thing we can try is each day writing a very short summary in the morning of what what we hope to accomplish for the day and in the evening what we've actually accomplished (1 or 2 sentences each). This would include days where we don't plan or have not accomplished anything (weekends we can assume people are not working).

Standup: Today I plan on working on the questions.md file by moving questions from previous years that address the contexts.md design doc into the questions.md doc. Nick and I discussed a format for the questions.md doc that I hope to demonstrate so that we can discuss whether it works for everyone.
I also plan on trying to make progress on figuring out which survey host to use for China.
I failed to do my standup yesterday. Sorry for that!
Standup: I was able to add questions that address Rust at work. I also added some information on survey platform support in China.
I have a PR almost done will post soon. As well as that I reviewed PR 16. I didn't get as much done as I should have and will try and do another hour or two over the weekend before I disappear
https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/pull/18
I reckon the next work to do is on demographic info, but I wasn't sure if Jasun had started that work
@Jasun Carr can you give us an update on your progress with the demographic information?

Nick Cameron said:

https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/pull/18

@Nick Cameron I appreciate it's late there so no worries if you want to stop working on this. I can continue it. I will have feedback on it ASAP though
I’m not going to be able to do any more tonight, but I’ll do some tomorrow or Sunday.
I made a few replies, but I’m on mobile, sorry if they’re a bit brief
I'll be spending today going through the demographic information document and getting those questions set. (Sorry for not jumping in the convo sooner. )

Standup
Learning GitHub as I go, so hope this worked. Made edits to a branch of the questions.md, and submitted a pull request to merge back. The questions are not fully set, as some queries/TODOs remain, but in better shape.
Also finalized testing of SurveyHero as a platform. Given that it is (based on research from Xidorn) more reliable in China and will meet our needs structure-wise, this should be the platform we request subscription to from the Foundation.
I updated https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/pull/18 with some more justifications and an extra question (and some notes), and addressed most of the comments.
@rylev would it be useful to have a quick chat tonight?
Going forward, I'll have a little time to fixup PR 18 and hopefully to review PRs, but I won't be able to write anything new for a while

@Nick Cameron I’ll take a look at the prs today and get things merged. I can then make a bit more progress. If you have time a little later in the week we can chat, but I don’t think it’ll be necessary. I should be able to make progress, and we can review when you’re back
Stand up: I'm going to continue working on adding more questions to the survey
@Jasun Carr please let us know if you'll be able to make progress today, and if so, what you'll be working on

Yes, I had a meeting cancelled mid-day, so I will be working on the questions themselves, focusing on wording and order of the questions we currently have in place. I'm hoping that may help identify any areas where we're lacking information that we need/want. (For example, among the folks not using Rust- Why on Earth are they taking this survey? And how did they come across it?)
I'll only have an hour or two, but I will be in there
@Jasun Carr please make sure to submit any changes you have at the end of your day so that I can work off of your changes tomorrow
Made a PR for small (mostly formatting) changes: https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/pull/22

Made a pr for adding more questions from previous year's surveys. Most of the questions are slated for removal, but it's important we get them in the doc so we can discuss them: https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/pull/25
Made edits today on a number of questions, added some possible ways to address a number of TODOs, and a couple other things.
Made a few edits to the survey. It's getting to the point where I may need some clarification on specific items and feedback on the proposed questions.
If I want to check in on the status, what is the best document for me to look at? https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/blob/main/surveys/2021-annual-survey/questions.md ?

nikomatsakis said:

If I want to check in on the status, what is the best document for me to look at? https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/blob/main/surveys/2021-annual-survey/questions.md ?

Yep that's where we're currently working. We're mostly just going through the old questions and making sure we justify their existence
When @Nick Cameron is back, we'll likely have a sync meeting to review the entire document before we more aggressively ask for feedback from teams.
OK. I've been thinking about "things I would like to know"
Please feel free to start a discussion here, open an issue on GitHub, or submit a PR! :blush:
Following up from Tuesday's meeting, I filed some issues and made https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/pull/33
I've been swamped today so I couldn't get to survey stuff, but I plan on doing this first thing tomorrow.
Did some work in questions - looks like most TODOs are accomplished. Will hold for final updates on remaining issues and on status of survey platform
